alert.note: Alert for Eastern, Central El Paso County; Western El Paso County (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Excessive Heat Warning issued July 07 at 8:40PM CDT until July 11 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT SATURDAY NIGHT... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT SATURDAY NIGHT TO 6 AM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Heat Advisory, temperatures of 105 to 108 degrees. For the Excessive Heat Warning, dangerously hot conditions with temperatures near 110 degrees possible. * WHERE...Western El Paso County and Eastern/Central El Paso County. * WHEN...For the Heat Advisory, until midnight MDT Saturday night. For the Excessive Heat Warning, from midnight Saturday night to 6 AM MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The Excessive Heat Warning will likely be extended through at least mid-week next week.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Eastern, Central El Paso County; Western El Paso County
